# Question

Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

```julia
function wrap_string(s::String; text_width::Int=10)
    words = split(s, " ")
    wrapped = String[]
    line = ""

    for word in words
        if length(line) + length(word) + 1 <= text_width
            line *= " " * word
        else
            push!(wrapped, strip(line))
            line = word
        end
    end

    if line != ""
        push!(wrapped, strip(line))
    end

    return join(wrapped, "\n")
end

# Example usage:
input = "Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet consectetur adipiscing elit sed do eiusmod tempor incididunt ut labore et dolore magna aliqua"
println(wrap_string(input, text_width=20))
```

Example use case: to split text into multiple lines when the string exceeds a certain character limit (`text_width`).
